edu.smcm.ai.search

Class Problem

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.smcm.ai.search.Problem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SlidingBlockProblem

    public abstract class Problem
extends java.lang.Object
    The abstract formulation of a classical search problem. Each problem must implement a specific set of methods. See Russell and Norvig, Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, Third Edition, p 66.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Problem()

      • actions

        public abstract java.util.List<Action> actions(State state)
        Obtain a list of actions that are legal in a given state.
        Parameters:
        state - the state for which actions are required
        Returns:
        a list of legal actions

      • isGoalState

        public abstract boolean isGoalState(State state)
        A recogniser method for the goal state.
        Parameters:
        state - state to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the state is a goal state

      • result

        public abstract State result(State state,
                             Action action)
        Apply an action to a state. The action is applied to the supplied state to obtain a new state (the successor state).
        Parameters:
        state - start state
        action - action to take
        Returns:
        resulting state

      • cost

        public abstract double cost(State start,
                            Action action,
                            State end)
        Compute the step cost of going from one state to another via a specified action.
        Parameters:
        start - the state in which the action is to be taken
        action - the action to be taken
        end - the state resulting from the application of the action
        Returns:
        the cost of the step

      • childNode

        public Node childNode(Node parent,
                      Action action)
        Create a child node in the search tree. See Russell and Norvig, Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, Third Edition, p. 79.
        Parameters:
        parent - node for initial state
        action - action to be taken
        Returns:
        node for resulting state

      • initialNode

        public Node initialNode()
        Create the node for the root of the search tree.
        Returns:
        initial node of search
